hypothesis_content.title: Bear-to-Neutral Transition on Declining Volume During Capitulation
hypothesis_content.statement: During BEAR regimes where BTC experiences 3+ consecutive down days with expanding volume, a subsequent down day with volume dropping 30%+ below the 10-day average signals exhaustion and high probability (>65%) of transition to NEUTRAL regime within 3-5 days, particularly when occurring near historical support zones.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Capitulation phases typically end on high volume as weak hands exit. Declining volume on further price decline suggests selling pressure exhaustion. Combined with negative funding rates (shorts overcrowded) and technical support, this creates conditions for bear regime termination.
entry_conditions: 3+ consecutive red closes with each day's volume > previous day's
Day 4 is red but volume < (10-day average volume * 0.7)
Price within 15% of major historical support level (e.g., previous cycle high, 200-week SMA)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime classifier shifts to NEUTRAL with >65% confidence OR 8% rally from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price breaks below support level with volume expansion > 20% above average

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Less than 55% of such signals lead to NEUTRAL regime within 5 days when support level is more than 20% below entry price.
